Periodic sequences

Sequences can also demonstrate different behaviours. There areexamples of sequences where certain patterns of values are repeated. Fromally we define the following.

The sequence \(u_1, u_2, u_3, \ldots\) is said to be periodic if the same terms are always repeated, e.g. \[ u_1, u_2, \ldots, u_p, u_1, u_2, \ldots, u_p, u_1, \ldots \]

The number of terms which are repeated (\(p\)) is called the period of the sequence. Considering our earlier example of \(u_n=(-1)^n\), the sequence repeats the values \(-1, 1\) over and over again, so it is periodic with period 2.
